content: Rui Wang's Homepage Rui Wang çé ruiwang@zju.edu.cn; wang.rui@acm.org +86-571-88206681 ext 430 Room 430, Meng Minwei Hall Zijingang Campus, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, 310058, China About Me I am a professor at State Key Lab of CAD&CG, Zhejiang University. I'm working in the area of computer graphics. Current interests are mainly in real-time rendering, realistic rendering, GPU-based computation and 3D display techniques. I received my Ph.D. in Mathematics in 2007 and my Bachelor's degree in Computer Science in 2001 from Zhejiang University. Now, I am working on a real-time rendering engine project (RaysEngine). Welcome talented master and Ph.D. candidates to contact me and join in this project. Recent News Our two works, "IntrinsicControlNet: Cross-distribution Image Generation with Real and Unreal" and "A3GS: Arbitrary Artistic Style into Arbitrary 3D Gaussian Splatting", have been accepted by ICCV 2025. Our three works have been conditionally accepted by SIGGRAPH 2025. "Dual-Band Feature Fusion for All-Frequency Neural Global Illumination" will be appeared in conference track, and "A Fully-statistical Wave Scattering Model for Heterogeneous Surfaces" and "Streaming-Aware Neural Monte Carlo Rendering Framework with Unified Denoising-Compression and Client Collaboration" will be appeared in journal track and published in ACM Transactions on Graphics. Our work, "MoFlow: Motion-Guided Flows for Recurrent Rendered Frame Prediction", is accepted by ACM Transactions on Graphics. I will serve as a member of Technical Papers Committee of SIGGRAPH Asia 2025. I serve as a member of Technical Papers Committee of CVM 2025, EGSR 2025, PG 2025. Our work, "Neural Global Illumination via Superposed Deformable Feature Fields", is accepted by SIGGRAPH Aisa 2024. Our work, "LightFormer: Light-oriented Global Neural Rendering in Dynamic Scenes", is accepted by SIGGRAPH 2024 and appeared in ACM Transactions on Graphics. I serve as a member of Technical Papers Committee of SIGGRAPH Asia 2024. I serve as a member of Technical Papers Committee of CVM 2024, EG 2024, HPG 2024. Show More Our work, "Microsnoop: A generalist tool for microscopy image representation", is accepted by The Innovation (Impact Factor 32.1), a journal of Cell Press. Two our works, "FuseSR: Super Resolution for Real-time Rendering through Efficient Multi-resolution" and "Adaptive Recurrent Frame Prediction with Learnable Motion Vectors", are accepted by SIGGRAPH Asia 2023. Our work, "NeLT: Object-oriented Neural Light Transfer", is accepted by ACM Transactions on Graphics. Our work, "I2-SDF: Intrinsic Indoor Scene Reconstruction and Editing via Raytracing in Neural SDFs", is accepted by CVPR 2023. Our work, "Optical Neural Network via Loose Neuron Array and Functional Learning", is accepted by Nature Communications, a journal of Nature Press. I serve as a member of Technical Papers Committee of SIGGRAPH 2023. I serve as a member of Technical Papers Committee of EGSR 2023, HPG 2023, PG 2023. Our work, "Data-driven Digital Lighting Design for Residential Indoor Spaces", is accepted by ACM Transactions on Graphics and its teaser image is selected as the cover image of this issue. Our work, "Real-time Monte Carlo Denoising with Weight Sharing Kernel Prediction Network", is a top cited paper in Journal Computer Graphics Forum 2021-2022 (certificate). Our work, "Scellseg: A Style-aware Deep Learning Tool for Adaptive Cell Instance Segmentation by Contrastive Fine-tuning", is accepted by iScience, a journal of Cell Press. Our work, "Learning-based Inverse Rendering of Complex Indoor Scenes with Differentiable Monte Carlo Raytracing", is accepted by SIGGRAPH Asia 2022. Two our works, "A Compact Representation of Measured BRDFs Using Neural Processes" and "ShaderTransformer: Predicting Shader Quality via One-shot Embedding for Fast Simplification", are presented in SIGGRAPH 2022. I serve as a member of International Program Committee (IPC) of the Eurographics 2022. I gave an invited talk introducing our recent works of Neural Representaton of Light Transports and Verse Vice in ChinaVR 2022. I am continuing serving as a member of International Program Committee (IPC) of the HPG 2022. I gave an invited talk introducing our recent works of Neural Representaton and Rendering in CAD/CG 2021/22. Two our works, "MINERVAS: Massive INterior EnviRonments VirtuAl Synthesis" and "Multirate Shading with Piecewise Interpolatory Approximation", are accepted by Pacific Graphics 2022. I am serving as an Area Executive Editor of Computational Visual Media (CVM). Our work, "Automatic Mesh and Shader Level of Detail", is accepted by IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics. Our work, "PowerNet: Learning-based Real-time Power-budget Rendering", is published in IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics (Volume: 28, Issue: 10). I am serving in Editorial Board of Young Scientists of Journal of Computer Science and Technology (JCST). Our work, "Color Contrast Enhanced Rendering for Optical See-through Head-mounted Displays", is accepted by IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics. Our work, "Foveated light-field display and real-time rendering for virtual reality", is published in OSA Applied Optics, 60(28), and selected as the Editor's Pick. I am continuing serving as a member of International Program Committee (IPC) of the HPG 2021. Our work, "A Practical Path Guiding Method for Participating Media", is published in Computational Visual Media, 6(1), and selected as the Spotlight Paper. Our work, "Adaptive Incident Radiance Field Sampling and Reconstruction Using Deep Reinforcement Learning", is published in ACM Transactions on Graphics (TOG), 39(1), and its teaser image is selected as the cover image of this issue. I am serving as one of the Program Chairs of the International Conference on Computer-Aided Design and Computer Graphics (CAD/Graphics) 2021.
